p: Table 5 shows that there were 622 study participants with emotional conditions, 497 with somatic responses, 527 with reduced sleep quality, and 471 with behavioral changes. For some conditions, during the two-week study period, the condition became serious and some became better, particularly for sleeping sleep quality 36.43% of study participants reported severely impaired sleep quality, and only 20.3% improved. The same findings occurred with somatic or physical conditions, which became worse in 39.44% and improved in 29.78%. Behavior improved during the two-weeks study period (95% CI, 0.102â€“0.722).
